meanings.definition: A sudden, widespread decline in a population of organisms.
meanings.sent1: The dieoffs of the fish in the lake caused concern among scientists.
meanings.sent2: The dieoffs of bees have been linked to pesticide use.
meanings.sent3: The dieoffs of the ants at the picnic made the humans the new rulers of the food.
meanings.sent4: The dieoffs of the trees in the forest painted a bleak picture of nature's fragility.
meanings.sent5: The dieoffs of the birds left the skies eerily quiet.

meanings.definition: The act of dying off or perishing in large numbers.
meanings.sent1: The dieoffs of the buffalo were a tragic sight on the plains.
meanings.sent2: The dieoffs of the bacteria in the experiment were unexpected.
meanings.sent3: The dieoffs of the cookies at the party left the guests disappointed.
meanings.sent4: The dieoffs of the stars in the galaxy signaled the end of an era.
meanings.sent5: The dieoffs of the candles left the room in darkness.
